alert.note: Alert for Gogebic (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 2:49PM EDT until April 16 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from dams. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Bessemer. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of Hedberg Road Bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 11.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 08/16/1972. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 715 AM EDT /615 AM CDT/.
